subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: Simon Wakefield chipped in for birdie at the last hole to finish with a 73 and tie Fredrik Andersson for the third-round lead in the Johnnie Walker Championship yesterday in Gleneagles, Scotland.Andersson shot a seven-under 66 in a difficult wind on the Centenary Course to total nine-under 210 three hours before Wakefield finished his round.Mark Warren (73) was a stroke back. Lee Westwood (69), Alastair Forsyth (72) and Phillip Archer (73) were next at 212.Thomas Levet, who shared the second-round lead with Wakefield, was in the hunt until a double-bogey 7 at the 16th.Colin Montgomerie shot a 71 and was four strokes off the lead. Paul Casey, the defending champion, was another stroke back after a 73.
